rows.title: In CSS Flexbox, why are there no "justify-items" and "justify-self" properties?

152:
<p><strong>This is due to the one-dimensional nature of flexbox, and that there may be multiple items along the axis, making it impossible to justify a single item</strong>. To align items along the main, inline axis in flexbox you use the <code>justify-content</code> property.</p>
<p>Reference: <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout/Box_Alignment_in_CSS_Grid_Layout" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Box alignment in CSS Grid Layout</a></p>
